description: From Ancient Greek σῖγμα (sîgma), σίγμα (sígma), probably from the root sig- as seen in σίζω (sízō) (< sig-yo "to hiss") + -μα (-ma).

entries.meaning: The eighteenth letter of the Classical and Modern Greek alphabets, the twentieth letter of Old and Ancient.
(mathematics) The symbol Σ, used to indicate summation of a set or series.
(statistics) The symbol σ, used to indicate one standard deviation from the mean, particularly in a normal distribution.
examples: None of the spikes seen by the experiments is at much more than the "two sigma" level of certainty.A level of "five sigma" is required to claim a discovery, meaning there is less than a one in a million chance the data spike is down to a statistical fluke.
